title.narrative: Support of the Independent Review for the Implementation of the Joint Inter-Sectoral Analysis Framework (JIAF) 2021

description.narrative: The Joint Intersectoral Analysis Framework (JIAF) is a methodologically new approach to analyzing the multiple needs of populations in crisis. Version 1.0 of the JIAF was introduced by the international humanitarian community into the Humanitarian Programme Cycle guidance in 2020. The JIAF offers a common method, process and tools to conduct a ‘people-centred’ holistic analysis of needs. The JIAF reflects an important evolution in the humanitarian community’s ability to systematically and transparently identify the most vulnerable populations, where they are, the combination of needs they face, and their severity. The JIAF was designed with the objective of providing a solid evidence-base to inform humanitarian responses, and where necessary, facilitate the prioritization of financial resources to populations and localities where intersectoral needs are the most severe. This project contributes to the supporting costs of the JIAF independent review, which is due to take place between May-September 2021. The review is being commissioned in order to independently assess whether the current JIAF 1.0 conceptual framework and methodology are fit for purpose, and what changes need to be made before the JIAF is fully institutionalized globally (JIAF 2.0).

sector.narrative: Movement, Emergency and Post-Crisis Migration Management
Relief co-ordination; protection and support services

policy-marker.narrative: Project with some but insufficient inclusion of gender issues
